Async function to execute code (depricated)

async.Rd

Async function to execute code (depricated)

async(expr, name = NULL, envir = parent.frame())

Arguments

expr

expression for async exe
name

see 'details'
envir

environment of code

Details

If name is NULL, expression will be evaluated and nothing will be returned. However, if name is specified, you can call function get_async_result(name) later to get the results if once evaluated. WARNINGS: if your expression contains large object, the memory will be doubled. This is because R doesn't support multi-thread and multisession mode will copy those objects if they are mentioned in the expression. Therefore please optimize your code carefully.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
# NOT RUN
# Will not block
library(future)

async({
  # block session for 3 secs
  Sys.sleep(5)
  return('Hello world!')
}, name = 'test') ->
  f

# Still running
resolved(f)

# wait for 5 sec
Sys.sleep(5)

# ready!
resolved(f)
get_async_result('test')
# END
}
